rules.title: Dead Ball Fouls
rules.summary: Infractions that occur while the ball is not in play (after a whistle, before a snap).
rules.administration: Penalties are enforced from the succeeding spot and do not cancel the down.

rules.title: Live Ball Fouls
rules.summary: Infractions that occur during the play while the ball is live.
rules.administration: Penalties are enforced from the previous spot, spot of the foul, or end of run depending on context.

rules.title: Unsportsmanlike Conduct
rules.summary: Any non-physical action by players or coaches that shows poor sportsmanship.
rules.administration: 15-yard penalty. Two in one game = disqualification.

rules.title: Coach Tip: Working With Officials
rules.summary: Advice from a 14-year veteran referee on how to be respected by the crew.
rules.quote: Coach, have you ever seen an official change a call after someone screams at them?
tips: Know the rules better than your opponents
Ask calm, rule-based questions — not emotional ones
Call a timeout to dispute a rule application (not judgment)

rules.title: What Color is Your Rule Book?
rules.summary: NFHS rulebooks are always green. This phrase reminds coaches to study the rules, not argue emotions.
rules.lesson: If you can cite the rule and its misapplication — and you know the color of the rulebook — you’ve earned a listen.
